/wiki/Almirante_Brown_Department: Almirante Brown Department is the westernmost department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Pampa_del_Infierno: Pampa del Infierno is a town in Chaco Province, Argentina. It is the head town of the Almirante Brown Department. The town was founded on December 7, 1927.
/wiki/Bermejo_Department,_Chaco: Bermejo is the easternmost department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/La_Leonesa: La Leonesa is a town in Chaco Province, Argentina. It is the head town of the Bermejo Department.
/wiki/Chacabuco_Department,_Chaco: Chacabuco Department is a western department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Charata: Charata is a city in the province of Chaco, Argentina. It has 26497 inhabitants as per the 2010 census [INDEC], and is the head town of the Chacabuco Department and the most important city in the southwest of Chaco, located 280 km from the provincial capital Resistencia.
/wiki/Comandante_Fern%C3%A1ndez_Departme: Comandante Fernández Department is a central department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Presidencia_Roque_S%C3%A1enz_Pe%C3: Presidencia Roque Sáenz Peña (normally known as Sáenz Peña) is a city in the province of Chaco, Argentina. It is the second largest in the province. It is located 170 kilometres (110 mi) west-northwest of the provincial capital Resistencia, on the main rail and road route across northern Argentina to Salta. The city has a population of 76,377 for the urban area (localidad) and 88,164 for the whole municipality (2001 census [INDEC]).
/wiki/Doce_de_Octubre_Department: 12 de Octubre is a western department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/General_Pinedo,_Chaco: General Pinedo is a town in the south of the province of Chaco, Argentina. It has about 16,000 inhabitants as per the 2001 census [INDEC], and is the head town of the 12 de Octubre Department.
/wiki/Dos_de_Abril_Department: Dos de Abril (April 2) is a south western department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Hermoso_Campo: Hermoso Campo is a town in Chaco Province, Argentina. It is the head town of the Dos de Abril Department.
/wiki/Fray_Justo_Santa_Mar%C3%ADa_del_Or: Fray Justo Santa María del Oro is the most south western department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Santa_Sylvina: Santa Sylvina is a town in Chaco Province, Argentina. It is the head town of the Fray Justo Santa María del Oro Department. The town was established in 1944.
/wiki/General_Belgrano_Department,_Chaco: General Belgrano is a central department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Corzuela: Corzuela is a town in Chaco Province, Argentina. It is the head town of the General Belgrano Department. It was founded on April 30, 1917.
/wiki/General_Donovan_Department: General Donovan is a  department of Chaco Province in Argentina, named after General Antonio Donovan.
/wiki/Makall%C3%A9: Makallé is a town in Chaco Province, Argentina. It is the head town of the General Donovan Department.
/wiki/General_G%C3%BCemes_Department,_Ch: General Güemes is the largest and the northernmost department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Juan_Jos%C3%A9_Castelli,_Chaco: Juan José Castelli (usually abbreviated to Castelli) is a town in the province of Chaco, Argentina. It is located 274 km from the provincial capital Resistencia and has about 27,000 inhabitants as per the 2010 census [INDEC]. It is the head town of the General Güemes Department. Its population is mainly of Volga German descent.
/wiki/Independencia_Department,_Chaco: Independencia is a central department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Campo_Largo,_Chaco: Campo Largo is a town in the province of Chaco, Argentina, and the capital of the department of Independencia. It is located 197 km west-north-west of Resistencia. The population in 2001 was 10,743.
/wiki/Libertad_Department,_Chaco: Libertad is a department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Puerto_Tirol: Puerto Tirol is a town in Chaco Province, Argentina. It is the head town of the Libertad Department.
/wiki/Libertador_General_San_Mart%C3%ADn: Libertador General San Martín is a department located on the north eastern border of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/General_Jos%C3%A9_de_San_Mart%C3%A: General José de San Martín is a city in the north-east of the province of Chaco, Argentina. It is named after José de San Martín, the Argentine general who played a major role in South America's fight for independence from Spain (see Argentine War of Independence).
/wiki/Maip%C3%BA_Department,_Chaco: Maipú is a central department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Tres_Isletas: Tres Isletas is a town in Chaco Province, Argentina. It is the head town of the Maipú Department.
/wiki/Mayor_Luis_Jorge_Fontana_Departmen: Mayor Luis Jorge Fontana is a southern department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Villa_%C3%81ngela: Villa Ángela is a city in the province of Chaco, Argentina, 186 km west of the provincial capital Resistencia.  It is on the Gran Chaco, a lowland region of the Río de la Plata basin.  It has 43,511 inhabitants as per the 2001 census [INDEC], making it the third largest in the province.
/wiki/Nueve_de_Julio_Department,_Chaco: Nueve de Julio  is a department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Las_Bre%C3%B1as: Las Breñas is a city in Chaco Province, Argentina. It is the head town of the Nueve de Julio Department.
/wiki/O%27Higgins_Department: O'Higgins is a  department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/San_Bernando,_Chaco: San Bernardo is a town in Chaco Province, Argentina. It is the head town of the O'Higgins Department.
/wiki/Presidencia_de_la_Plaza_Department: Presidencia de la Plaza is a  department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Presidencia_de_la_Plaza: Presidencia de la Plaza or simply Plaza is a town in Chaco Province, Argentina. It is the head town of the Presidencia de la Plaza Department.
/wiki/Primero_de_Mayo_Department: Primero de Mayo is a south eastern department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Margarita_Bel%C3%A9n: Margarita Belén is a town in Chaco Province, Argentina. It is the head town of the Primero de Mayo Department.
/wiki/Quitilipi_Department: Quitilipi is a central department of Chaco Province in Argentina.
/wiki/Quitilipi: Quitilipi is a city in Chaco Province, Argentina. It is the head town of the Quitilipi Department.
